//Services Students and staff can make use of the following services that are available on campus:
Minor ailments Quick consultations for common health issues like headaches, minor injuries, or stomach troubles. Ideal for addressing small health concerns without a full doctor\'s appointment. We also offer expert care for issues affecting the ear, nose, and throat, as well as eye conditions, skin conditions & sexually transmitted diseases. Ear, Nose, and Throat Conditions: Expert care for issues affecting the ear, nose, and throat, such as ear infections, sinus problems, or sore throats. Skin Conditions: Consultations and treatments for various skin concerns, from rashes and minor irritations to skin infections. Sexually Transmitted Infections: Confidential testing, diagnosis, and treatment for sexually transmitted infections, ensuring privacy and comprehensive care. Eye Conditions: Services related to eye health, covering issues like red eyes, minor infections, or other non-severe eye conditions. Keep an eye out for our regular health campaigns that will provide you with the necessary information to keep you in good shape.
Chronic medication Prescribed drugs and treatments designed for the long-term management of ongoing medical conditions. Management and dispensing of medications for chronic conditions, ensuring continuity of care. Anti-retroviral (ART) medication: Anti-retroviral medication is a specific category of chronic drugs used in the treatment of HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus) infection. ART works by suppressing the replication of the virus, slowing down the progression of HIV to AIDS (Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome), and helping individuals with HIV lead healthier and longer lives. Pre-exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP): Pre-exposure prophylaxis is a preventive medication strategy aimed at reducing the risk of contracting certain infections, primarily HIV, before potential exposure. In the context of HIV prevention, PrEP involves taking specific antiretroviral medications regularly to lower the chances of acquiring the virus, particularly for individuals at high risk of exposure. It is a proactive approach to safeguarding against infection."
Screenings Prescribed drugs and treatments designed for the long-term management of ongoing medical conditions. Management and dispensing of medications for chronic conditions, ensuring continuity of care. Cholesterol Cholesterol is a fatty substance in your blood. Monitoring cholesterol levels is vital for heart health. Knowing your cholesterol status can guide lifestyle choices and dietary habits, promoting a heart-friendly life. Blood pressure measures the force of blood against your artery walls. It\'s an essential indicator of heart health. High blood pressure can lead to various health issues, so regular checks help ensure your heart is happy and healthy. Screenings Screenings Screenings
Sexual health Comprehensive sexual health services, including various contraceptive options tailored to individual needs and preferences.
Men\'s health Women\'s health
Helpline Clinic Staff Support Services
//Health Tips Daily wellness & wisdom! Get quick tips to help you stay healthy - stress relief, nutrition hacks, and more for a healthier you.
//Quick Tips Quick Tips Instant health boosts for your busy campus life. Take the stairs for a mini workout. Get sunlight for a mood lift. Deep breathing for stress relief. Keep healthy snacks in your bag. Use a study timer for focus. Stay hydrated with water breaks. Prioritize tasks with to-do lists. Stand or stretch every hour. Connect with friends daily. Quality sleep is non-negotiable. Find Out More...
Health & Wellness Explore tips and activities to enhance your overall wellness, fostering a balanced and fulfilling lifestyle.
Stress Management Discover practical and effective techniques for managing stress and finding calm.
Healthy Eating Explore smart and simple nutrition tricks for a balanced diet.
Sleep Hygiene Learn about habits that contribute to good sleep hygiene for better sleep quality.
Exercise & Fitness Discover the benefits of exercise and fitness practices to enhance physical health and overall well-being.
Campus Safety Gain insights and tips on maintaining personal safety and security within the campus
Sexual Health Education Explore educational content to make informed decisions regarding sexual well-being, reproductive health, and relationships.
Mental Health Support Discover support systems, coping strategies, and information to foster a positive mental health environment.
Stress Relief Hacks
Managing Relationships
For More Health Tips, Visit Our Website Delve into a variety of health-related insights. From general wellness advice to specific health concerns, this section offers a diverse range of tips to enhance your overall well-being.
